channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024021012
item.description:
Report X-2024021012

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: a trainer informed one the admin that there was a leaking hazmat on a trailer. Grabbed my PPE and the red hazardous waste bin to get the damaged hazmat. Brought it back to QA, began to inspect. There were 4 bottles in a black trash bag. DescribePack: One of the bottle liquid level was lower than the rest. The cap does not look like it was completely secured on the bottle and leaked out. DurationRel: 18 and MitigateEffect: Kept the box and the bottles upright to prevent any more leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024020551
item.description:
Report X-2024020551

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF DRY ICE ROLLING AROUND IN THE BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS ALSO COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWENTY-SEVEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING A MEDICAL VIAL OF IMLYGIC. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PENNSYLVANIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 4F82MT, INNA PRIKHODKO, 20 HAMPTON RD., SUITE B, LYMAN SC 29365-9773. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024020268
item.description:
Report E-2024020268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: CARNEGIE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/12/2024, I john Vergis Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE, was called by the WLE Car Shop Manager @0730 hrs. about tank car UTLX 205661 leaking in the WLE Rook Yard. When I arrived to look at the car, I could see that is was leaking product from the protective housing on top the car. I got on top the car and removed seal number 451443 from the protective housing cover and noticed that product was leaking from the Sample Line Valve. Product was leaking from the valve plug. I checked to see of the valve handle was shut and it was not tight. I turned the valve handle one complete turn before it was shut tight. I then checked to see if the valve plug was loose and when I touched the plug, it fell out. I installed new thread sealant on the plug and installed it in the valve and tightened it tool tight. I then cleaned off the top and sides of the car the best I could. I installed new seal number 0000225 on the protective housing lid and then released the car back into transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024020238
item.description:
Report E-2024020238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to a broken pallet puncturing one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. First Call Environmental personnel removed all freight from the trailer and then neutralized the impacted area. The spent material was recovered and placed into one 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged 55-gallon poly drum with the remaining product was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • City: ZELIENOPLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package presented in Unload, and had small amount of leakage on the outside of package. Given to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Inspection found a dent in the metal container lid where and estimated 2oz of liquid was released. The outter package had no indications of being damaged with the exception of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was contained to package. Package was taken to Hazmat cage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by a package handler during the morning unload. Manager was informed and package was brought to QA to be processed. DescribePack: The package contained 4 bottles of rapicide cleaner. 1 was wet but lid appeared tight. Assuming product froze since it was below zero. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Made sure that all lids were tight and placed back in securely.

item.title: Report X-2024020773
item.description:
Report X-2024020773

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: HERMITAGE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At the time of unloading this bucket from the trailer, the staff realized that it had spilled a little and so they called QA, we looked for the ERG and we printed the SDS and then proceeded to clean up the spill. DescribePack: The lid of the bucket was not fully secured, which caused it to open and spill its contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill area was cleaned, the bucket with the muriatic acid was placed inside a black bin to prevent further/more spillage, and the bucket was taken to the Hazmat cage andplace in a drum.

item.description:

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package was found on trailer # 805618 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2 x 2.5 gallon plastic bottles of BWT-95 boiler water iron dispersant 1 x 2.5 gallon plastic bottle of BWT-95 boiler water iron dispersant had an crack along the seam of the bottle allowing all 2.5 gallon to release package had no bags absorbent or slotted partitions Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of BWT-95 boiler water iron dispersant had a crack along the seam of the bottle allowing all 2.5 gallon to release from the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020479
item.description:
Report X-2024020479

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-21
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat on the hazmat pallet in QA, it had purple wet stain on the box. Grabbed my PPE to further inspect the damaged. DescribePack: There weren't enough packing materials to ensure the safety of the contents in the box. The box could hold up to 4 bottles of a 1 gallon each but there were only 2 in the box. There is a small puncture on the body on one of the bottles near the bottom. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Had to turn the bottle upside down to prevent any more leaks since the hole is at the bottom of the body of the bottle.
